Something's wrong. {@LinkCreature:50#1002} is late—and he's never late.

I worry that he's found something fascinating in the caves underground and lost track of time...or he's run afoul of the argons.

Would you mind looking for him?
It pleases me to see you again, but I'm not sure what brings you here.<NEXTPAGEBUTTON>"Your friend is worried about you."</NEXTPAGEBUTTON>

No botanist worth his loam could pass up a chance to explore the Viridian Caverns. The resilience of nature astounds me.

Also, I got a little lost.

Legend tells us that Yurian blessed the Viridian Caverns due to the fierce devotion of a remarkable castanic. This might explain the cavern's resilience.<NEXTPAGEBUTTON>"He was a warrior?"</NEXTPAGEBUTTON>

No, no—SHE was a romantic.

Her name was Imalia and she loved these caverns. She tended them, cleaned them, and protected them.

One day, she met a man, Tiparius, who'd taken shelter in the caverns. One look at his handsome face and she fell in love."You sure it wasn't just loneliness?"
Definitely love—and he loved her back. For a time, they were the happiest couple on Shara.<NEXTPAGEBUTTON>"What happened?"</NEXTPAGEBUTTON>

Tiparius wanted to move on. He'd seen enough of Northern Shara and longed to return to Castanica.

Imalia felt torn between her love for him and her obligation to the caverns. Tiparius begged her to come with him, but she chose to stay."She gave up love for a cave?"

No, no! She...she gave it up for duty. Yurian admired her dedication and preserved the caverns so her sacrifice wouldn't be in vain.

Well now, how about we find {@LinkCreature:250#1002}?

The truth is, I'm lost. I have to meet {@LinkCreature:250#1002}, but can't remember the right route. He's probably worried sick.

Could you show me the way out?

For getting a flighty botanist to safety, I thank you.

Perhaps I'll carry some chalk with me next time I venture underground.
